definition: Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: Fees will be charged for real-time quotes of Hong Kong Stocks only, details are enclosed overleaf.
sentences.chinese: 將僅就港股即時報價收取費用，收費詳情載於背頁。

sentences.english: He also announced plans for funds that would let mainland Chinese investors trade Hong Kong stocks.
sentences.chinese: 他還宣佈中國計劃推出讓內地投資者投資港股的基金。

sentences.english: Other Asian arms of U.S. companies have also given HKEx a boost.
sentences.chinese: 其他美國公司的亞洲子公司也給香港股市帶來了提振。

definition: Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
red chip stocks (Chinese company stocks incorporated outside mainland China and listed in the Hong Kong stock exchange)
Taipei Stock Exchange, abbr. for 臺北股市|台北股市[Tai2 bei3 Gu3 shi4]
Standard and Poor (share index)/abbr. for 標準普爾|标准普尔[Biao1 zhun3 Pu3 er3]
